perturbation.original_text: SECTION THREE. PRIOR APPROVAL   Company agrees that no use of the name of the NFLA Identification nor any item used in connection with the name of NFLA Identification (including any Licensed Product) will be made under this Agreement unless and until the same is approved by the NFLA. The NFLA agrees that any material, advertising or otherwise, submitted for approval as provided in this section may be deemed by Company to have been approved under this section if the same is not disapproved in writing within ten (10) business days after receipt of the material.
perturbation.changed_text: SECTION THREE. PRIOR APPROVAL   Company agrees that no use of the name of the NFLA Identification nor any item used in connection with the name of NFLA Identification (including any Licensed Product) will be made under this Agreement unless and until the same is approved by the NFLA. The NFLA agrees that any material, advertising or otherwise, submitted for approval as provided in this section may be deemed by Company to have been approved under this section if the same is not disapproved in writing within two (2) business days after receipt of the material.
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the approval period from ten business days to two business days. This creates a potential legal issue if the approval process requires more time to ensure compliance with advertising standards, potentially leading to rushed or inadequate reviews. This could contradict state advertising laws that mandate sufficient time for review and approval.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State advertising laws related to reasonable review periods for marketing materials.

perturbation.original_text: SECTION SEVEN. PAYMENTS   All payments shall be made by wire transfer drawn to the account of NFLA-NC no later than ten (10) business days after the end of each quarter as follows:   $0.05 per Unit as described herein of Company's Products sold in the Contract Territory payable to NFLA-NC. Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the NFLA-NC beginning on the first full quarter (three month period) of the Agreement and continue on a quarterly basis thereafter for the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: SECTION SEVEN. PAYMENTS   All payments shall be made at the Company's discretion, whenever funds are available.  Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the NFLA-NC at the Company's convenience.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces significant ambiguity and eliminates the defined payment timeline, contradicting typical contract law requirements for clear payment terms. State prompt payment laws require businesses to adhere to specific payment deadlines. This also contradicts the initial 'ten (10) business days after the end of each quarter' promise. This creates uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State prompt payment laws, breach of contract principles.

perturbation.original_text: SECTION NINE. DEFAULT   A. If either party at any time during the Contract Period shall: (i) fail to make any payment of any sum of money specified in this Agreement to be made; or (ii) fail to observe or perform any of the covenants, agreements or obligations under this Agreement (other than the payment of money), the non-defaulting party may terminate this Agreement as follows: As to a default under clause (i) above, if such payment is not made within 10 business days after the defaulting party shall have received written notice of such failure to make payment; or, as to a default under clause (ii) above, if such other default is not cured within 30 days after the defaulting party shall have received written notice specifying in reasonable detail the nature of such default.
perturbation.changed_text: SECTION NINE. DEFAULT   A. If either party at any time during the Contract Period shall: (i) fail to make any payment of any sum of money specified in this Agreement to be made; or (ii) fail to observe or perform any of the covenants, agreements or obligations under this Agreement (other than the payment of money), the non-defaulting party may terminate this Agreement immediately.
perturbation.explanation: The change removes the cure periods for defaults, allowing immediate termination. Some states mandate a reasonable opportunity to cure breaches of contract before termination. By removing the cure period, the contract could be deemed unconscionable or in violation of good faith and fair dealing principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws regarding breach of contract, right to cure, good faith and fair dealing.
